medical_history.chief_complaint: Urinary tract infection (UTI) with malodorous urine.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant presented with poor feeding, sleepiness, and dark, malodorous urine at 40 days of life. Symptoms progressed to lethargy, mottling, tachycardia, and hypothermia. Following treatment for her initial UTI, she returned with similar symptoms three additional times over nine weeks, each time requiring rehospitalization and treatment with different antibiotics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born by cesarean delivery at 32 5/7 weeks of gestation; hospital stay included 2 days in neonatal ICU.
medical_history.family_history: Two months after the index patientâ€™s initial presentation, her 2-year-old sister was diagnosed with UTI caused by an E. coli strain resembling that of the index patient. The other two siblings were reported as healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The father works as a janitor in an academic medical center ICU; the mother is a homemaker with previous experience as a labor and delivery ward nurse.
